{
    "tool": "web_search",
    "query": "what happened in the louvre museum during the last two days?",
    "raw": {
        "results": [
            {
                "title": "France Reveals What Was Stolen From Louvre Museum - Art News",
                "url": "https://www.artnews.com/art-news/news/what-was-stolen-louvre-crown-jewels-photos-1234757886/",
                "content": "Information regarding the burglary that occurred on Sunday, October 19, at the Louvre Museum

This Sunday, October 19, the Louvre Museum experienced a break-in and theft in the Galerie d’Apollon, which houses the royal collection of gems and the French Crown Jewels. Two high-security display cases were targeted, and several items of inestimable heritage value were stolen, including: [...] No injuries were reported among the public or staff.

The Minister of Culture wishes to thank the Louvre’s staff for their responsiveness and great professionalism.

She also recalls that, as part of the “Louvre – New Renaissance” project announced by the President of the Republic last January, an ambitious new security plan is being implemented, including:

 Enhanced security measures with new-generation surveillance cameras;
 Perimeter detection;
 A new security command center. [...] Skip to main content 

ARTnews

Subscribe

TO ART IN AMERICA

# France’s Ministry of Culture Just Revealed Exactly What Thieves Stole From Louvre, Including a Crown With 3,000 Diamonds

Several hours after news broke that thieves had broken into the Louvre Museum in Paris and stolen royal jewels of “incalculable” value, France’s Ministry of Culture sent out a press release officially detailing what was stolen in the robbery.",
                "score": 0.87166095

# Louvre Museum theft: Stolen jewels added to INTERPOL's Stolen Works of Art database

21 October 2025

Home   News and Events   News  2025  Louvre Museum theft: Stolen jewels added to INTERPOL's Stolen Works of Art database

Eight items remain missing following brazen theft

LYON, France – On Sunday, 19 October 2025, at 09:30, thieves broke into the Louvre Museum in Paris and stole nine items of priceless jewellry. [...] Four suspects entered the museum’s Galerie d'Apollon (Gallery of Apollo) using a mechanical ladder mounted on a vehicle. They cut through the display cases and fled with the culturally significant items, which date back to France's 19th-century royalty and are encrusted with thousands of diamonds and other precious gemstones.

A crown once belonging to Empress Eugenie of France was recovered from the scene, seemingly dropped by the intruders. Eight other items remain missing.",
                "score": 0.7813477
            },
            {
                "title": "Manhunt underway for 4 suspects after heist of 'priceless' jewelry at ...",
                "url": "https://abcnews.go.com/International/manhunt-underway-4-suspects-after-brazen-heist-louvre/story?id=126672414",
                "content": "As the investigation to identify the culprits continued, a crisis meeting took place at the Interior Ministry that included Dati as well with the Banditry Repression Brigade (BRB), the special police unit of the Ministry of Interior that investigates major art thefts, authorities said.

The Louvre remained closed for a second day on Monday and the museum is refunding tickets that have already already purchased by visitors.

## 7 minutes, in and out, authorities say [...] PARIS -- As the alarms sounded at the Louvre Museum on Sunday morning, four suspects took off on two motorbikes, winding their way through central Paris, allegedly carrying with them a haul of "priceless" jewelry once worn by queens and royals.

The suspects were last seen speeding southeast on Highway A6 out of Paris and in the direction of Lyon, according to investigators. [...] French President Emmanuel Macron and other French officials vowed that the pieces would be returned and the suspects apprehended. The museum closed on Sunday morning as police swarmed the area in search of suspects and evidence.

"The theft committed at the Louvre is an attack on a heritage that we cherish because it is our history," President Emmanuel Macron said on social media on Sunday.",
                "score": 0.77055156
            },
            {
                "title": "Louvre closes after thieves steal 'priceless' jewels in daytime heist",
                "url": "https://www.lemonde.fr/en/france/article/2025/10/19/louvre-closed-for-the-day-after-a-robbery-according-to-culture-minister_6746572_7.html",
                "content": "France's Culture Minister Rachida Dati reported on Sunday, October 19, that a robbery had taken place at the Louvre in Paris, as the world-renowned museum said it was closing for the day. "A hold-up took place this morning at the opening of the Louvre Museum," she wrote on X. "No injuries reported. I'm on site with museum staff and police." [...] The Louvre, which welcomed nearly nine million visitors in 2024, 80% of whom were foreigners, announced on social media that it would remain "closed" on Sunday "for exceptional reasons."

According to a source close to the investigation cited by Agence France-Presse (AFP), between 9:30 and 9:40 am, thieves reportedly arrived on scooters and used a freight elevator to access the room they were targeting. They were reportedly equipped with small chainsaws, according to a police source.",
                "score": 0.75027883
            },
            {
                "title": "2025 Louvre robbery - Wikipedia",
                "url": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_Louvre_robbery",
                "content": "On 19 October 2025, thieves disguised as workers stole eight pieces of the French Crown Jewels from the Galerie d'Apollon of the Louvre in Paris, France. The robbery took four minutes and happened during regular opening hours.( It was the first art theft from the Louvre since the 1998 theft of the painting _Le chemin de Sèvres_.(

response.name: web_search
response.body:
{
    "tool": "web_search",
    "query": "what happened at the louvre",
    "raw": {
        "results": [
            {
                "title": "History of the Louvre Museum: 5 Key Events",
                "url": "https://myprivateparis.com/5-key-dates-in-the-history-of-the-louvre/",
                "content": "On August 25, 1939, just days before the outbreak of World War II, the Louvre decided to evacuate its artworks to safe locations across France. Museum staff, led by director Jacques Jaujard and curator Rose Valland, orchestrated a daring operation to safeguard thousands of artworks from the looming threat of war and potential Nazi occupation. This initial evacuation marked the beginning of a concerted effort to protect France’s cultural heritage throughout the duration of the conflict. [...] In May of 1871 during the Paris Commune, the Tuileries Palace (adjacent to the Louvre) was set on fire. The fire raged for two whole days destroying much of the palace’s interior, including priceless artworks and furnishings.

## August 25, 1939: World War II – The Evacuation of the artworks [...] On this historic day, the Louvre opened its doors as a public museum. During the French Revolution, the government repurposed the former royal palace, the Louvre, to showcase France’s artistic treasures. The inaugural display featured over 500 paintings, including masterpieces by renowned artists such as Leonardo da Vinci, Raphael, and Rembrandt.

## August 21, 1911: The Theft of the Mona Lisa",
                "score": 0.79901963
            },
            {
                "title": "Louvre remains closed a day after daring theft of Napoleonic jewels",
                "url": "https://apnews.com/article/louvre-closed-jewel-heist-2cc473fc178ae6a3513daa0c71b43409",
                "content": "On Sunday, thieves rode a basket lift up the Louvre’s facade, forced a window, smashed display cases and fled with priceless Napoleonic jewels, officials said. The theft occurred about 30 minutes after the museum opened, with visitors already inside, and was among the highest-profile museum thefts in living memory.

It unfolded just 250 meters (270 yards) from the Mona Lisa, in what Culture Minister Rachida Dati described as a professional operation that lasted just a few minutes. [...] Updated [hour]:[minute] [AMPM] [timezone], [monthFull] [day], [year]

Leer en español

Share

 Facebook
 Copy

  Link copied
 Print)
 Email
 X
 LinkedIn
 Bluesky
 Flipboard
 Pinterest
 Reddit

PARIS (AP) — The Louvre remained closed Monday, a day after historic jewels were stolen from the world’s most-visited museum in a daring daylight heist that prompted authorities to reassess security measures at cultural sites across France. [...] In a minutes-long strike inside the world’s most-visited museum, thieves rode a basket lift up the Louvre’s facade, forced a window, smashed display cases and fled with priceless Napoleonic jewels. Here’s what to know.

French Justice Minister Gerald Darmanin acknowledged security failures on Monday.",
                "score": 0.79675186
            },
            {
                "title": "Louvre Museum theft: Stolen jewels added to ... - Interpol",
                "url": "https://www.interpol.int/en/News-and-Events/News/2025/Louvre-Museum-theft-Stolen-jewels-added-to-INTERPOL-s-Stolen-Works-of-Art-database",
                "content": "LYON, France – On Sunday, 19 October 2025, at 09:30, thieves broke into the Louvre Museum in Paris and stole nine items of priceless jewellry.

Four suspects entered the museum’s Galerie d'Apollon (Gallery of Apollo) using a mechanical ladder mounted on a vehicle. They cut through the display cases and fled with the culturally significant items, which date back to France's 19th-century royalty and are encrusted with thousands of diamonds and other precious gemstones. [...] A crown once belonging to Empress Eugenie of France was recovered from the scene, seemingly dropped by the intruders. Eight other items remain missing.

Image 11: WOA_Theft at the Louvre Museum_Poster.jpg

The stolen jewels have been added to INTERPOL’s Stolen Works of Art database, which combines descriptions and pictures of more than 57,000 items from around the world. It is the only database at the international level with certified police information on stolen and missing objects of art. [...] What are you searching for ?

Louvre Museum theft: Stolen jewels added to INTERPOL's Stolen Works of Art database

21 October 2025

Home

Image 3: >

News and Events

Image 4: >

 News 

Image 5: >

 2025 

Image 6: >

 Louvre Museum theft: Stolen jewels added to INTERPOL's Stolen Works of Art database 

Image 7: Print this page;)Image 8: Facebook INTERPOLImage 9: X INTERPOLImage 10: Scroll to top;)

 Eight items remain missing following brazen theft",
                "score": 0.7797419
            },
            {
                "title": "Museum heists have changed. Why the Louvre robbery is a worrying ...",
                "url": "https://www.cnn.com/2025/10/20/style/france-louvre-heist-worrying-escalation-intl-hnk",
                "content": "Police were met with several pieces of evidence when they arrived at the Louvre. Discarded by the truck were two grinders, a blowtorch, gasoline, gloves, a walkie-talkie, and a blanket. Laying nearby was a more eye-catching item, the crown of Empress Eugénie, the wife of Napoleon III, dropped by the thieves as they made their escape on Yamaha T-Max scooters along the Seine river.

The ornate gold piece, which features 1,354 diamonds and 56 emeralds, was damaged in the heist, prosecutors said. [...] Paris’ Louvre Museum had already been open for 30 minutes, and welcomed hundreds of visitors through its doors, when thieves in yellow vests scaled a truck-mounted ladder to the second-floor balcony of the Apollo Gallery, home to the French crown jewels, among other treasures.

Using an angle grinder to force open a window, they took just four minutes to enter the room, cut open two cases displaying Napoleonic jewels, grab nine pieces and flee back down the ladder. [...] Image 2: Police stand guard outside the Louvre museum at Louvre on October 19, 2025 in Paris, France.

Police stand guard outside the Louvre museum at Louvre on October 19, 2025 in Paris, France.

Remon Haazen/Getty Images

Crime Visual arts

See all topics

Facebook TweetEmailLink

 Link Copied!",
                "score": 0.7447496
            },
            {
                "title": "Louvre Robbery Raises Questions About Security",
                "url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2025/10/21/world/europe/louvre-robbery-security-paris.html",
                "content": "To anyone strolling along the banks of the Seine, just across the road, it might not have been immediately apparent that the setup was a ruse and that a daring robbery was underway. Workers are a common sight around the Louvre, an ancient, sprawling former palace, whose basic upkeep and renovations make it a constantly transforming construction site. [...] The four thieves arrived on the south side of the Louvre on Sunday morning at 9:30 and pulled a truck up on the sidewalk, right next to the museum walls. They posed as workers, wearing yellow vests and setting out traffic cones. [...] But inside the museum, where visitors were already snaking their way through more than eight miles of exhibition space, the drama that was unfolding would soon become clear. Two of the thieves used an electric ladder attached to their truck to reach the Apollo Gallery, with its treasury of priceless crown jewels, then used power tools to break through a window.

Subscribe to The Times to read as many articles as you like.",
                "score": 0.6889923
            }
        ],
        "error": null
    },

response.name: New Request

body.raw: {"query":"what are the different types of distance measuring sensors?"}

response.body:
{
    "query": "what are the different types of distance measuring sensors?",
    "context_judge_result": "context_provided",
    "agent_response": {
        "tool_used": "local_llm",
        "summary": "There are several types of distance measuring sensors, which can be categorized based on their measurement principles, signal processing methods, and application-specific requirements. Here are some common types of distance measuring sensors:

1. **Infrared (IR) Sensors**: These sensors use infrared radiation to measure distances by detecting the changes in intensity or reflection. They are commonly used in applications such as remote control systems, object detection, and safety monitoring.
2. **Ultrasonic Sensors**: Ultrasonic sensors emit high-frequency sound waves towards a target object, which bounces back as an echo. The distance is calculated based on the time difference between the emitted wave and the received echo. They are commonly used in robotics, navigation, and industrial automation applications.
3. **Optical Distance Sensors**: These sensors use light to measure distances by detecting changes in reflectivity or transmission. They can be categorized into two sub-types:
	* **Visual distance sensors** (e.g., cameras): These sensors use visible light to estimate distances.
	* **Infrared light sensors** (e.g., thermal imaging sensors): These sensors use infrared light to detect temperature differences and estimate distances.
4. **Radiometric Distance Sensors**: Radiometric distance sensors measure distances by detecting changes in the radiation emitted or absorbed by an object. They are commonly used in applications such as remote sensing, environmental monitoring, and navigation.
5. **Acoustic Distance Sensors**: These sensors use sound waves to measure distances by detecting the time difference between the emitted and received sounds. They are commonly used in industrial automation, robotics, and building inspection applications.
6. **Laser Distance Sensors**: Laser distance sensors use laser light to measure distances by detecting changes in reflection or diffraction patterns. They are commonly used in applications such as navigation, robotics, and precise positioning systems.
7. **Capacitive Distance Sensors**: Capacitive distance sensors use changes in capacitance between two conductive plates to estimate distances. They are commonly used in applications such as proximity sensing, object detection, and pressure measurement.

These types of distance measuring sensors have different strengths, weaknesses, and application-specific requirements, making them suitable for various industries and use cases."
    }
}
